rest.ftp

Class RestToFtpResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • rest.ftp.RestToFtpResource

  • @Path(value="/ftp")
public class RestToFtpResource
extends java.lang.Object
    A REST Application Resource which access to a FTP Server. It defines Resource pathname and contents. The Resource is accessible at apiAddress/ftp with apiAddress the Application address.
    Author:
    cachera - falez

    • Method Detail

      • processGetRequest

        @Path(value="{uri: .*}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response processGetRequest(java.lang.String uri,
                                               @Context
                                               javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo ui)
        Manages GET Request of the REST application and spreads it to the FTP Server. The REST Application will send to the FTP Server a LIST Request or a RETR Request depending on the uri. If the uri refers to the path of a folder, it will be a LIST Request, if it refers to the path of a file, it will be a RETR Request.
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI of the GET Request. It affects the kind of request sent to the FTPServer.
        ui - Some basics informations about the URI
        Returns:
        Either the content of the requested file (RETR) or the requested folder (LIST) as a Response

      • getLoginInformation

        public static java.lang.String[] getLoginInformation(javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo ui)
        Return the couple username/password with the URI information. If no information is found, return anonymous login mode
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI information of the request.
        Returns:
        A String array containing the username and the password of the login

      • processDeleteRequest

        @Path(value="{uri: .*}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response processDeleteRequest(java.lang.String uri,
                                                  @Context
                                                  javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo ui)
        Manages DELETE Request of the REST application and spreads it to the FTP Server. It will send a RM Request to the FTPServer in order to delete the file referred by the uri
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI of the DELETE Request. It's the path of the file to delete.
        Returns:
        A Response object containing informations about the FTP Server response

      • processPutRequest

        @Path(value="{uri: .*}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response processPutRequest(java.lang.String contents,
                                               @Context
                                               javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo ui)
        Manages PUT Request of the REST application and spreads it to the FTP Server. It will send a STORE Request to the FTPServer in order to add a file. The file will be referred by the uri.
        Parameters:
        contents - The content of the file to add.
        ui - Some basics information about the URI.
        Returns:
        A Response object containing informations about the FTP Server response
